citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the licensee did not have records of disposition for 18 hedgehogs.
Complete and accurate records of disposition are necessary to track animals used in regulated activities to ensure their
humane care, use, and disposition. The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and
correctly disclose information concerning each animal purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his
or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that
licensee.
To be corrected by October 4, 2023.

At the time of the inspection, the licensee did not have a documented contingency plan for the facility.
If an emergency or natural disaster were to occur at the facility, the lack of a written contingency plan could impact animal
health if the facility is not prepared to respond to the situation appropriately. The licensee must develop, document, and
follow an appropriate contingency plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of
their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
To be corrected by October 4, 2023.
No regulated animals present at this time.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
